pkgmetadata.longdescription: Embryo is primarily a shared library that gives you an API to load and control interpredted programs compiled into the abstract machine bytecode that it understands. This abstrac (or virtual) machine is imilar to a real machine with a CPU, but it is emulated in software. The architecture is simple and is the same as the abstract machine (AMX) in the SMALL (http://www.compuphase.com/small.htm) language as it is based on exactly the same code. Embryo has modified the code for the AMX extensively and has made it smaller and more portable. It is VERY small. The total size of the virtual machine code AND header files is less than 2500 lines of code. It includes the floating point library support by default as well. This makes it one of the smallest interpreting engines around, and thus makes is very efficient to use in code.
